website_summaries.verdict: The overall feedback towards the Charged Assert 8 has been positive. Runners are generally appreciative of what this Under Armour running shoe had to offer. The underfoot cushioning system and the lightweight construction are particularly highlighted as the sources of all-day comfort, even when the product is used for casual purposes. On the other hand, the durability and blister-inducing fabrics of the upper are criticized.Fans of neutral running shoes that are specially made for neutral foot pronation are the target market of the Under Armour Charged Assert 8.
pros: Many consumers claim that the Under Armour Charged Assert 8 has a comfortable construction that allows them to wear it all day
Most testers believe that this running shoe has a versatile look that permits it to be worn on a variety of occasions
The product is praised for being affordable and at par with the quality of materials and its performance
The weight of this road running shoe has been lauded for being light enough for extended running sessions
Several people are happy with the cushioning system of this shoe, stating that it responsibly cushioned each step
Surface traction is deemed reliable by those who appreciate precise movements on the roads
cons: A couple of purchasers report that the forefoot section of the upper unit has started to tear apart after only a few uses
Some runners lament the lack of support near the arch
The fabrics of the upper have a tendency to rub against the toes irritatingly, according to a few testers

customer_reviews.title: Fit Great and They're Not Made By Nike
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit great, look good and feel like they will last. Will use them primarily for running so I need to replace them every six months or so. Didn't really need them quite yet but the price was so good during Amazon's Prime Day Sale I couldn't pass them up.
customer_reviews.author: Dellah T.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’m sooooooo impressed with these shoes. Under Armour has always been my favorite brand but without being able to try them on at the store, I was skeptical of the fit. These are by far THE MOST comfortable shoes. I work in a prison on concrete floors and these give my great support. I’ll be ordering more for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Abel

customer_reviews.title: Trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: My son wears a size 15 and was in need of black sneakers. I was so happy with the delivery and how great these sneakers fit him. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Quickly becoming one of my favorites
customer_reviews.text: Under Armour is quickly becoming one of my favorite shoes. Great style and they offer wide sizes which can be hard to find. This is my second pair and I'm already looking for my third pair. I'm in the 300+ category and anyone that is a member in good standing in that club knows that weight can destroy a shoe if you aren't rotating them. They last so much longer and wear so much better if you can do it. I recommend these for anyone looking for an economical good looking shoe that looks good and wears comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Paul “The Answer” Paz

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST perfect
customer_reviews.text: I want a crisp pair of white, stylish, comfortable, and durable shoes. This is almost the perfect pair. These fit as expected, are comfortable for daily wear or for the gym. My issue with most styles of most brands is the white soles on most shoes. White soles get filthy dirty and in my opinion distract from the rest of the shoe. These shoes have mostly gray soles which will disguise most of the grime from use, but there is a portion that is left as white. If the gray were darker or black and covered the entire sole, I'd give these a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: DenverGuy71

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only owned these for a few weeks and the glued on thread is separating and the heals pop. These are so cheap I have had Walmart shoes last longer. Stay away from these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This manufacturer does not endorse that one football player.
customer_reviews.text: I discarded my other shoes, I just felt that I should JUST DO IT. This pair is very comfortable when I stand for the National Anthem.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: If you want a show with no support this is it.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible support!! Right out of the box, feel like they are months old in support. Waste of money, wanted to try another brand to avoid giving Nike my money. Bought these, and only screwed myself. Not fair to return them, after wearing them. But you do actually have to use a shoe for awhile to see the truth. Guess they will be okay working in yard etc. But if your going to be on hard surfaces, you might as well go barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: john k

customer_reviews.title: Not as the description states.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I am giving this product 1 star is the product is not the same as the picture and description. The picture shows black sneakers with black soles and the description states black/black. What I received was black sneakers with white soles. I returned the item and got a replacement however, the replacement was also black sneakers with white soles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: The inner sole is flat !  definetly not a running show
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look nice, but that's it. They can not be used for walking or running. The inner sole is flat, unfortunately, it was not written in any other review, I never saw any shoe like this ever, except for people with flat feet. not recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: "Haha" to these other reviews...
customer_reviews.text: The pictures of these shoes being totally shredded after 1 or 2 uses is hilarious. I don't know what gym people are exercising at... Planet Hiroshima? Anytime ISIS? By used the "elliptical", do they mean "rode a hippopotamus"? I put 18 miles on mine in the last two days and they look immaculate still. I think maybe this is just some weak minded individuals trashing a brand because their safe space got occupied by Under Armor for a split second in the media, circa 2016. I think I'll wear mine in the snow tomorrow, and crush some snowflake hearts.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Amazon stock shelves are crap
customer_reviews.text: I dont have a problem with the product! I have a problem with amazon! I needed the black on black shoe for work. When I got the first pair it was black on white, so I called customer service to make sure I ordered the correct pair, when I got the second pair you guessed it it was black on white. I have now sharpied the white on black just hope it stays
customer_reviews.author: william alford

customer_reviews.title: This is not the color shoe that I ordered....
customer_reviews.text: the shoe I ordered was black/black and the black/white was shown as not being in my size. I did not want black/white. I want black/black.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit on one foot!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews, the back of the shoe cuts into the back of the ankle on one shoe. Doesn't seem small at all but on one side it cuts into you right above your heel. Poorly made since they don't seem to fit the same on both feet. You don't notice until you're wearing them a while.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Blisters!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I go through running shoes about every 4-5 months. I've stuck with new balance and Nike but thought I'd give UA a shot. The first size 10 pair was too small and went back. The second 10.5 wide seemed like they fit well enough walking around the house but after a mile of fast-paced walking, they raised a blister right where the top of the heel cup touches the Achilles tendon area. I wear high-quality Thorlo running socks and have never had this problem with any other running shoe. Now they aren't returnable and I can either suffer, donate them, or throw them away. This has been an unpleasant experience and I WILL NOT be buying UA shoes again.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyB

customer_reviews.title: Great look and style
customer_reviews.text: Have a hard time finding shoes that fit properly and these are perfect. Had to order them on line because the stores didn’t have my size in stock.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not for long periods of time
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 pairs of shoes (2 navy 1 black) for my husband. At first they were great, he loved them. He said they fit comfortably but he noticed that after wearing them to work all day he would come home with sore feet and red toes. Not sure if it’s the sizing that’s off, but he’s not too pleased with this style
customer_reviews.author: Yana Muntyan

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I found this shoe to be very comfortable-light weight,supportive on my arch & easy on/off.. I also purchased the UA Charged Rogue at the same time as these UA Charged Assert 8. The Charged Rogue has a very stiff heal which requires the use of a shoehorn to get into the shoe. The shoe is comfortable but does not feel as light on my feet as these the UA Charged Assert 8. Having suffered Planter Fasciitis I am very fussy about a good fitting shoe. I do not run but I do a lot of walking and I highly recommend this shoe. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS227

customer_reviews.title: good looking, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and true-to-size-- but use your athletic shoe sizing. They're a "normal" fit instead of UA's usual slightly-narrow fit. I went for a mile+ brisk walk in the new shoes immediately, and they didn't pinch or rub at all, didn't even need to re-lace them. Literally no break-in. Very nice. These shoes have a nice modern look, with the classic white-sole aesthetic (but smartly with a black bottom, so they don't immediately look filthy). Only time will tell how well they hold up and how soon before the white parts are discolored. But for now, I'm very pleased. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Siddique

customer_reviews.title: Okay shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was referred by under Armour to me as a replacement for my dash 2 shoes, which I had for 2 years. These are nowhere near the show their Dash 2 was. I wish I would have bought 10 pair of the old ones. These feel like they are cardboard. I wear a 15 4E and they are really snug across the width. Under Armour, please bring back the Dash 2.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: 4E UA is not 4E other brands.
customer_reviews.text: I just received these shoes today and they are nice and comfortable with good cushion in the rear heel. I ordered the 4E size because the last time I ordered UA running shoes I bought the standard/normal width and they seemed a little narrow than other brands but I was able to live with them. These are 4E size 13 but they don't seem to be the same 4E width as other brands, they seem a little narrower than other 4E. I don't get it. I like them and don't plan to return them, however, I'll buy NB, Nike or Asiscs next time because UA makes narrow shoes even with 4E.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Like walking on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: I almost tripped down a flight of stairs wearing these because my feet were so cushioned and supported. Took a little getting used to, but now that I've broken them in, these shoes are absolutely the best for exercise. Treadmill, walking, jogging, weightlifting (to an extent), these shoes are comfortable and expand my performance capacity. Many thanks to Under Armour.
customer_reviews.author: jib jose

customer_reviews.title: The best shoes ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I had the original “prototype” back when they first released in the late 2000s and they were amazing back then. I have since bought 4 pairs of them and they are all equally as amazing. I’m flat footed, the arch don’t hurt my feet and gives me all the support I need. The price is freaking wonderful and I think these are honestly the best shoes that under armor makes. These have become my “comfy boi” shoes like you see dads wear with the with fluffy cloud new balance shoes. I am not one bit ashamed of it either. Hahaha I have these in multiple colors and duplicates for different occasions. I love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Prfine

customer_reviews.title: I like this shoe.  Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I did order a full size larger. These do run small. I like to treat my feet well. No complaints, I really like this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: My husband Loves them!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has very large awkwardly shaped feet. We struggle with every finding shoes that fit let alone styles that he likes. We got these through amazon wardrobe along with another pair. He instantly fell in love with these. He loved the design, the slight fresh snugness, the airy cushion and the stitch quality. He also loved the price being that it's also rare to find his shoes that cost less than a baby unicorn. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nishe

customer_reviews.title: Nice walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice comfortable shoe for general walking/wearing out and about. I haven't tried running in them as I tend to have pretty specific shoe fit needs and generally stick to Brooks. Historically I prefer Adidas for a general use shoe but that company seems to have gone to a cheaper shoes that is predominantly mesh with little support (i.e. the older, heavy duty Kanadia/Rockadia style trail shoes versus the "sock" like mess they are selling now for trail running). This is my first pair of Under Armor shoes but they remind me more of the older Adidas models as far as fit and support. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Donner

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality but would like a thinner size.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, love the look, and the shoe cushions my feet/arches quite well while running, jogging, and walking—like I’m on clouds. They’re also breathable as there are tiny spaces between fibers to allow air to pass through fairly well. A suggestion to the makers: With my feet being a little more narrow, I’d like an option for the shoe to have a thinner option, if possible. Otherwise, the fit for me was generally as expected and am quite pleased with the turnout! I hope these last for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Stiff Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is too stiff for my liking. I like a more flexible running shoe, the Charged Assert 8 Running Shoe does not live up to my preferred type of running shoe. I would also prefer more heel cushioning than this shoe offers. It is well built and I'm using them as a third choice running shoe. I am primarily using the Charged Assert 8 Running Shoe as a walking shoe, it is a comfortable stiff walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Zabal

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Ooooh I love and am happy! It’s men’s so I was soo skeptical of what size I would order. I am a size 9 in women’s. So i ordered a 7.5 in men’s. I got them today I tried them on and they fit perfectly! These are so nice like I am very picky about how my shoes look from my view down to my feet on shoes and theses are just perfect! They felt comfortable and my first pair of under armour and I am ready for gym.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe...but tight on Achilles
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this UA shoe for a number of years now....and I just re-buy the same fit/model whenever my old shoes are worn down. They're comfortable and affordable ($70). I mostly wear them for walking my kids to school or for weekend activities -- not too much long-distance running. For this recent shoe, though, I have started to get a red blist/chaffing on my Achilles heal due to the back of the shoe. I'm hoping it is just a short-term thing but something "new" that I've discovered after wearing the same type of shoe for several years now.
customer_reviews.author: James Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Great Initial Impression
customer_reviews.text: I just received these shoes, so I can't speak to longevity but the initial impression is strong. The cushioning material is a good balance between responsiveness and comfort. Noticeably less cushy than the Adidas Duarmo 9's I had before, and that's a good thing because those were squishy enough to be unstable. Feel somewhat comparable to the Adidas "bounce" midsole, which I like a lot. I think I like the bounce midsole a slight bit more than this, but Adidas isn't currently making any shoes with that sole that I like. Will edit this review if my impression changes with use.
customer_reviews.author: Msmith68W

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice for Walking
customer_reviews.text: These "running" shoes work very well as walkers for me. They are cool, light weight, very supportive, they reflect sunlight, and their styling is attractive. My only bit of disappointment is that the insole is not (apparently) removable, which means you either live with what's provided in the shoes or you add an insole, for example to help with falling arches. If you add insoles on top of the ones provided, you may start to create a shortage of headspace in the shoe. The better shoes that I have purchased in the past had removable insoles as I wish these did.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh man

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe for workouts or everyday use, but after about a month they’re very worn and look older than they actually are. Comfortable, but not very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Wide sizes are actually wide
customer_reviews.text: So anyone who has wide feet knows what a pain it is to find shoe that is truly "wide". We'll look no further, my feet are 10.5 wide and the second I put these shoes on it was like they were specifically made for my feet. I just got them today and I haven't run in them but I wore them the whole day and they are amazingly comfortable. For the price these are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: keith cleghorn jr

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad, but room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I really wanna gives these a 5 star review but as I work on my feet 10 to 12 hours a day all week long I can't. Ive had these for weeks and I feel like they are well broken in but they still leave my feet pretty sore. That being said, I do feel like these are good shoes, just maybe not for the type of work I'm doing on hard concrete, throwing boxes for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Bought two pair b/c they feel so great!
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin......I LOVE THESE SHOES!!! I have wide feet and where a size 12 US. This shoe fit my foot so well (I purchased during Black Friday) that I honestly bought another pair on Cyber Monday! They feel great!! I workout in these nearly everyday. These make for a good cross-trainer or even light to moderate running shoe. Again, if you have wid-feet, not to mention need arch support, buy these shoes dude!!!
customer_reviews.author: thatguy2257

customer_reviews.title: Comfy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super comfortable shoe! It feels like my feet are walking on clouds and the massages at the same time. At my work, I am on my feet all day, and he has been the most comfortable at this price quote I have bought the last 10 years working at this job. These fit as expected(they felt a smidge small/narrow. I’m still breaking them in. I’m usually a 10 1/2, and in this shoe I may be an 11), and I will buy a second pair because I like to rotate my sneakers every other day to give them a break so they don’t start to smell funky.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected, great looking and support, eyelet broke after 4th day
customer_reviews.text: I've had these over a month now and waited to drop my review to see how they broke in and lasted. The ONLY issue was that after the 4th day an eyelet on the left shoe broke. The stitching came undone. I gorilla glued it back together and so far so good. The soles are very springy and they have good support. I'm not using them for the gym or any strenous activity, just standing,walking and some stair climbing. They do fit as expected, I have 2 other pair of Under Armour shoes, all the same size. I recommend these but do watch the stitching on the eyelets.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Scudella

customer_reviews.title: Started to come apart
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn them a handful of times since I received them last month and they have started to tear and come apart. I only where them when running and only do so about once a week for an hour. They are very comfortable and light-weight, but I am very disappointed with the life of them, as I have only used them for about 6 hours total and they're already coming apart. I DO NOT recommend these if you intend to use them regularly and when working out as they will not hold up and you will have to order a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Carley Byrum

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe, no support when walking/jogging.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Shoe looks good. Thats about it. Dislikes: Not a good shoe for high intensity workout. No support, to soft, foot moves all over the place. It is fine for when lifting weights, but I tend to go on 5 to10 mile walks/jogs and the balls of my feet are both blistered bad. If you just walk to the kitchen or around walmart they’re are fine. But if you want an athletic shoe for fast pace movement they suck. Its like they’re made out of trampoline material and my foot moves all over the place. I’m sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Size Differs From Other Named Brand Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear size 11 Sketchers so I ordered a size 11. I tried then on an they were at least a whole size too small. I even checked the sizing chart and compared the sizing chart for Sketchers. Sending back and getting a different pair. Loved the style and over all look. The quality of the stitching, fabric and shoe laces seemed top notch.
customer_reviews.author: D G Boles II

customer_reviews.title: Love Under Armour shoes
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I found how comfortable this brand is. I only buy them for work. As a data installer I have put in 30,000 steps in one long shift before. This brand did not fail me. Were my feet tired? Well, yes it was 30,000 steps! However they were not sore. Much better then any other brand I have tried. I haven't put this particular shoe to that extreme of a test so far, but nothing seems different from previous Under Armour shoes so far. They fit exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Ruskey

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for running specifically. Nike’s always run on the small side so I thought I’d go with under Armour instead. Couldn’t beat the price. Fit was great. I have big, wide, and flat feet (Samoan). Very comfortable. Ran 3 miles as a test with no problem. I can see the material on the upper not lasting very long to anything rubbing against it. But I’m sure it’ll be fine with just running. Only thing I don’t like is the heel cup comes up fairly high and rubs my Achilles raw. I wear low cut socks and don’t plan on anything longer in these shoes, but it would definitely help.
customer_reviews.author: Alex vele

customer_reviews.title: Squeak squeak!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe initially fit nice and mostly comfortable. There could be just a little more cushion in the sole. After a month, I dont really feel any cushion anymore. Now the annoying part, my left shoe developed a squeak as I walk! I dont think I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: maverick

customer_reviews.title: Dont order wide unless
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. But I got the wide because I always felt that I had wide feet. Well, I probably do, But, the wide in this shoe is really WIDE...Had to return the first pair because they were to long, went down a size, fit better, but wish I hadn't got the wide width. Foot moves around too much, so I dont use them for running, but casual- because the black looks amazing. Will buy another pair this fall for running- without the WIDE option.
customer_reviews.author: fee services

customer_reviews.title: Damaged after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: As much as I like these shoes, I’ve had them for 2 months and they are already damaged. I just finished glueing a completely blown out piece of the side back into the shoe hoping it holds. The shoes look great and they are moderately comfortable to exercise in. I use them for walks and don’t remember catching them on anything. There is little to no scuffing one the shoes, so I’m not sure why they would have come apart there.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Quite a let down from Under Armour
customer_reviews.text: My shoes started to fall apart in less than 2 weeks. One of the strips of tread fell off while I was walking, luckily I was able to glue it back on. Amazon refuses to return or exchange them since they have been worn, despite them being obviously defective. The shoes also squeak when I walk which is driving me nuts. It isn't when they’re wet either - it is even when they’re completely dry and walking on dry carpet. Really disappointed in Under Armour for this one since their shoes usually give me no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Thicker than "Charged Impulse" / so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes so far. They are comfortable so far, though I am still in the break in period. Had a pair of "Charged Impulse" which are very similar looking, but the dog messed them up so got these instead. I think these are a better shoe. They seem to be better padded, both on the side and bottom. I think they were a bit more expensive. The tag on the Assert says it is made in Vietnam the Impulses were made in China.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: “You Get What You Pay For”
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were exactly what I expected, BUT! don’t be expect them to be like Brooks or Saucony $120 running shoes, and if you’ve been wearing high end running shoes, you, like me, won’t be running in these, at best, walking shoes (and get some inserts, there is minimal arch support). These shoes are fine for foot protection.
customer_reviews.author: Rezonator

customer_reviews.title: Too Small?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I would normally wear about an 11-3/4 men's shoe if they made that size -- 11-1/2 always feels too small and 12 always feel too big. So I got these at size 12 expecting them to be a little loose. Au contraire! They're painfully tight -- would probably need a 13 for them to fit. I'm not sure it makes sense to buy shoes.clothes without actually trying them on first -- there's just too much variation in sizing with products made around the world.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I liked that these shoes very comfortable and that they fit as expected some shoes have trouble doing these so I have to vary in shoe size based on shoe brand but fit very nice. I bought these in February 18 and they lasted until October 22 which is decent amount especially since I work in a factory all I do is move around so it made it very tolerable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look good but that’s about it.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this UA shoe. I usually love their shoes but this one was poorly made and I’ve already worked out in them twice so I can’t return them. The shoe way too small, the heel seems to sink towards the inside of the soles and they are just uncomfortable. The only good thing about them is they look nice. I’ll probably give them to my brother who wears one size smaller than me or just use them to housework.
customer_reviews.author: EJB

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Sooo breathable and so soft yet offers very good arch support. It's also very light. I am a physical therapist and have done extensive research on shoes that are good for patients. Etonics are the best but they don't make shoes much and it's not easy to find good Etonics. This shoe is perfect and meets all the check points. I bought two, one for my husband and another for my brother in-law. Both love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Fruit

customer_reviews.title: Order a whole size bigger.
customer_reviews.text: Can't really comment too much about the sneakers aside from the fact that they run small. My son is a 7.5 (just had him measured before ordering these) and the size is too small. We ordered the size 8 and that's too small as well. 8.5's are on the way so let's see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Day One Review
customer_reviews.text: Just got shoes in mail yesterday and gave a review of 4 star package came in just shipped in a shipping box the original Under Armor box was not with shoes not sure why but wanted to put that in review. The size of shoes was as expected and described as I have a wider foot I was concerned about width but shoes fit comfortably. One negative I would have is the heel of shoe is slim so could ya more support as far as heel goes but over all good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy shoes that do not break the bank
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have great support and manage to look stylish without breaking the bank. They run true to size but beware that they are a bit tight when first worn but that wears off within an hour or two strolling in them. The shoes feel great on both pavement and trials, and give a wonderful grip even on uneven terrain. Would definitely recommend, I even got another pair because they're so amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Majano

customer_reviews.title: You Can Do Better!
customer_reviews.text: Narrow is not the word I would use to describe these shoes. I tried to wedge my lifelong size 12 with Bombas low cut socks into this shoe to no avail. They honestly remind me of the cheap “stop and starts” my mom used to buy us when we were really poor! This size 12 seems a half size south of 12. Thank God for the return policy as they’re going back today.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey C

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Small
customer_reviews.text: I give it two stars because the shoes are somewhat small. I usually wear 7.5-8 in shoe size. I bought a size 8 and it's tight on my feet. It rubs on my ankle to the point of an uncomfortable pain. They're not as comfortable as I thought they were going to be. If you decide to get these shoes, I recommend that you get half a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing I have loved this brand for several years. I finally got my husband to try them and he LOVES them. He is an in his 70's and doesn't like to try new things. He worries about fitting his feet, pressure points, shoe parts pushing. He is 100% sold on these shoes, he loved the arch and the entire shoe. No plastic near the toes to case irritation. They are the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Carayas

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: So close to being great. They are do a good number to the back of my Achilles’ tendon area. I have ran twice with the same result. A blister on both feet in the first quarter mile. They are very comfy other than that with great grip. I feel like I’m floating with some extra speed than my filas. I like how they look but my wife thinks they are hideous. Meh, to each their own.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Holy Perfect, Batman
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I have ordered at least give ladies of shoes this last month and every one of them was completely ridiculous in difference from what as described. These sneakers are AMAZING. Not just good enough but so far past it. Their wide is actually wide, the materials are sturdy and SO comfortable. I'm really impressed truly. So grateful I won't have to file yet another return.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty comfortable shoes. They seem a little bit smaller than my New Balances I had prior to these but they still fit (just a little bit more snug). My main complaint will be that the fabric that the lace goes through came apart on one of my shoes in only about 1-2 weeks. That should definitely not happen. I just sewed it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Zackory

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice comfortable shoe. I bought a pair a few months ago. Wore them like everyday working in the yard and standing on concrete floors. Can't tell you anything about running or working out at the gym, however with these on my feet they never got tired or sore. They are my perferred working shoe. I just had to have another pair to wear with Jean's or shorts or just hanging out. They also look good.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I use this to run every single day and have had no complaints. It's been amazing! I would recommend this for anybody who needs a good pair of running shoes. It fit exactly as expected and that was a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Earnest Chae

customer_reviews.title: Great Price & Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12-year-old son who is now a size, 13 W. Do you have any idea how expensive name-brand sneakers are for kids? Thankfully, he is an underarmour kid and these sneakers were under $60. They fit well and look great. I also like the fact they have wide sizes available too, as he feels as though the wide is more comfortable. If the white soles get dirty, I just clean them with a magic eraser.
customer_reviews.author: Joy de Leyer

customer_reviews.title: I miss champion gusto...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit good, they feel pretty good, the sole of it is good and soft the shoe part is a little harder than I like. I like a shoe that is soft, fits snug and the actual shoe is soft not firm not with the rigid edges of the ridge back’s or anything like I can’t find any other really in my size 15 wide that don’t look like something a DJ would wear to work
customer_reviews.author: BigChris

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe looked great and fit okay. I have wide feet and somewhat flat feet. I really wanted these to work out for me but I decided to return them and buy a different brand that I am more familiar with. The other brand also fits much better for the type of feet I have. I recommend this shoe for other people but sad to say that it didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Saradpon Photography

customer_reviews.title: Small and narrow
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are small! My toes touch the end of the shoe and they are super narrow. I bought the same size I have for decades and this is the first time I’ve ever had this problem. It’s also the first time I’ve ever bought this brand. Apparently if you wear regular sized shoes you actually need to buy wide ones from UA.
customer_reviews.author: Deserteagle

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and amazing product.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is perfect, which is really nice as I have WIDE feet. The extra wide fits perfectly for the width of my feet, so I don't need a shoe that is 1.5 inches longer than my foot! Durability seems fine. My feet still get sore but I assume that's always gonna be the case when your job has you on your feet for 8 hours. Look very nice! Cheap as well, not super expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great product! 4E wide is  good wide size!
customer_reviews.text: Came in new box and initially looks very wide as I need them. These are size 12.5 4E for my son. Finding a good wide shoe for him is a challenge. I am pleased woth these!!
customer_reviews.author: HHeaton

customer_reviews.title: Man, these shoes are fast!
customer_reviews.text: But really. I love these shoes. They are very comfortable, super light, and they look great. At 56 years old and currently 240 lbs (jogging at a modest 8'44" pace and improving), I need shoes that will protect my knees, ankles and hips. I am being careful not to push it at my age and size, but these make easy work of 3 miles or so!
customer_reviews.author: joejones64

customer_reviews.title: My new daily drivers!
customer_reviews.text: I have found my new default shoe. These babies fit fine and are comfortable all day. I'm pretty sure this is the only shoe I'll be buying for a long time! Durability not yet tested since I've only had them for a week, but all I'm hoping for is that these at least last a year with no issues - if they do they are a total steal!
customer_reviews.author: cristobal rendon

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I went purely off reviews and name recognition for these. I was surprised to see a pair of UA shoes as inexpensive as these. However, I needed a new pair of running shoes and the reviews said these were great. I agree. These are very confortable, they fit as expected and they are worlds above the Nikes I was using to run. I recommend as a inexpensive replacement to your current shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Gino M

customer_reviews.title: Narrow shoe...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and well made shoes except they're narrow. I suggest order a half to a 1 size larger than your regular size especially if you intended to wear sock with the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf2

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR RUNNING
customer_reviews.text: The shoes looked great! I love the colors, but: 1.- no support or cushion, especially in the front of the shoe. I can feel every rock in the road. 2.- the back of the shoe comes up high and in towards the foot, therefore rubbing above the heel. Too bad, I don't think I can return them since I already ran outside with them. NOT FOR RUNNING!
customer_reviews.author: palatkagas

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for casual slow runner, but not enough support for a fast runner
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great, no doubt for the price. If you are just a regular jogger or power walker these shoes are not beatable for the price. However, if you are a fast runner, 8-9 mil per mile, these have not support. After 3 miles, you can feel the shock really well, which isn't a good situation to be in, and you might want to spend a lil more money on a real running shoe with somewhat more cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Burak Oezdemir

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I really love these sneakers. They are very supportive and also very light and comfortable. I have used them working out and for the treadmill and for walking outside and I am really impressed. The fit is just as expected, and the width is good as well. I'm not sure how they will hold up, time will tell. Love them so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for distance running!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put about 15 miles on these shoes (running about a 8:00 pace) and I’m delighted. I was getting shinsplints my old shoes and they have gone away. Not to mention, I feel like the shoes keep me leaning forward slightly which has increased my pace without feeling like I’m working harder. I strongly recommend these for any distance runners.
customer_reviews.author: First Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable but Slightly Tight Heel Cup
customer_reviews.text: Lightest, most comfortable running shoe I’ve ever owned with one exception. The top of the heal cups curve aggressively toward my Achilles creating some rubbing so it took a while to break in that part. Otherwise it’s a great shoe. I ordered a half size larger than normal and though I have medium width feet, the extra wide fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hudd

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoe for the price. I was born with club foot so good support is a lot to me, and if it's a bad shoe my foot will let me know but these shoes feel great, even when worn for extended times. And they look great as well. I've never had or heard of an Under Armor shoe, but I'm pretty sure these will be the shoes I'll keep buying now on.
customer_reviews.author: Deidra Banks

customer_reviews.title: He loves them!!
customer_reviews.text: The Boyfriend wanted these for work, he's a paramedic. Some days they go none stop and are on all types of terrain. He read all of the reviews wanted them more. We are usually Nike people, I went ahead and ordered them for him. He's had them for a few months now and ABSOLUTELY LOVES them!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Sharp looking, tough sneaks
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of UA's that looked alot like these years ago and I adored them. They lasted forever. Never did fall apart or anything. Just wore out the soles after about three years. These seem to be as good or better. I've worn them nearly every day now for about two weeks and they look and feel like new still. Love'em.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolner

customer_reviews.title: I walk about 7-8 miles a day in these shoes with my dog, and they're great
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes specifically because I wanted a pair to walk in without wearing out my normal everyday sneakers. I love these shoes. They fit perfect (I normally wear size 10.5) and they are light and comfortable. I hardly ever think about them when I'm walking my dog, which is always a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B

customer_reviews.title: Black and Black
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes with a flat soft sole. I ordered size 12 and I could have gone 12 1/2, they ran a bit small but still fit (only a bit tight). The black/black combo is exactly that, black upper and black lower. I was looking for a full black work shoe and these are. Don't know yet on longevity but comfort seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Scotts

customer_reviews.title: Worst shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst shoes ever...took a chance and bought these after wearing a model they dont sell anymore. I have never had any foot problems before and after wearing these shoes for a few weeks developed horrible foot pain....months later (wearing different shoes now) I still have pain in my arches and heels. I can't stand on my feet very long anymore but I did get some better shoes and they are so much better. Unfortunately it appears it may take several months for my feet to heal :(
customer_reviews.author: Silas Barker

customer_reviews.title: My First Running Shoes; Excellent Choice!
customer_reviews.text: David Goggin's has inspired me to run to callus my mind. So I decided to purchase some running shoes. These are super comfortable! It feels like I'm stepping bare feet on a cloud. I don't like Nike because they felt too narrow for me. These were a perfect fit, could be placebo but oh well, I love these. Highly highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: These are not a comfry shoe.
customer_reviews.text: First thought, to thigh send back. Then, well maybe they will loosen and be perfect fit for walking. BINGO!! They are not a all day shoe, period. They give excellent support and comfort for aggressive walks. Then off they come for other roomy shoes. I really do like them a lot !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an all black shoe and happened to come across this pair. Glad I bought them. Very comfortable and nice looking. Like I do with Nike I ordered a size larger (reviews) and they fit like a charm. First pair of Under Armour, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: virginiason

customer_reviews.title: Under Armor
customer_reviews.text: well I’m a diabetic my feet hurt a lot because of my neuropathy amazing shoe feels like I’m walking on cotton I’ll definitely be buying another pair
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Arrived as ordered
customer_reviews.text: This brand arrived as ordered in size 7.5 brand new and in shoe box. I have recently switched to under armour as I have found this brand to provide comfort and support for my feet as I do a lot of walking at work on concrete floors. I ordered these through the amazon prime wardrobe option trying out for up to 7 days at which time decide to keep or return. Also, I know on some new shoes whether bought online or in actual store that sometimes they can have a musky odor to them when worn the first few times but these don't or any of the other under armour shoes I own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,
customer_reviews.text: SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK,SQUEEK, These shooes actually start quiet. By the end of a12 hour shift my wife can hear me coming from a a mile away. I AM RETIRING THESE FOR YARDWORK ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight and comfortable shoe. These are my 4-5th pair of under armour running shoes and these may be the most comfortable. Super light and spongy yet good support. Wide toe box that doesn’t automatically lace tightly when you pull the laces tight if that makes sense. I bought 2x pair.
customer_reviews.author: bowhunter

customer_reviews.title: Black on black looked better online
customer_reviews.text: The black on black looked better online then it did in person. Still a solid shoe for running and comfortable, I returned them to exchange for a half size bigger but that was my fault , the shoes fit true to size. I’m going to get the navy blue or od greenish type instead. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small, Had to reorder bigger size.
customer_reviews.text: So the shoe looks well made and everything but the shoe was too small. I just ordered two other shoe brands and they fit fine so it wasn't mistake it is just slightly too small. Reordered a half size bigger and I am going to be sending this one back. When I get the one that fits ill update my review
customer_reviews.author: Austin W.

customer_reviews.title: Simply Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have become my daily go-to since buying them. Not only are they great for fitness, but I opt to wear them casually pretty much any time they fit the rest of the style of my attire. Really just some fantastic shoes. Very comfortable, good looking, and after a few months now I would also say durable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H.

customer_reviews.title: Width is smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my husband, they are the same size as his old Under Armour shoes. He has been trying to 'break them in' and make them work, but they are just way too narrow for him and rub against his toes.
customer_reviews.author: Scion7

customer_reviews.title: For the Fiance, he's happy
customer_reviews.text: So order a half of a size up since they run a little small but otherwise the feedback I got was very positive from him. He stated that they didn't need any type of breaking in and extremely comfortable. They showed up quickly and look as nice as the pictures. Hopefully they dont wear out too fast!
customer_reviews.author: Dory

customer_reviews.title: Under Armour shoes are worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. I have loved under armour for several years and now was finally able to own a pair. They are great shoes. The inside is a bit harder then the normal comfort shoe but that helps me greatly and after two days I got use to them. They make my walks more comfortable and they seem springy. I have worn them for three weeks with no sign of wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hilde (Israel)

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking and fitting shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I received these very fast and I was worried since it's the first item I have ordered that required proper fit. They arrived in the correct box and packaged as would a pair you buy in a store. They are beautiful shoes, but still they had to fit and they fit exceptionally well. I wear size 10 in a Nike shoe and 10.5 in Under Armor. These shoes did not disappoint at all and I am very glad I ordered them because one thing about retail is that you often have to settle for what they have in stock. Good job Amazon! Awesome delivery time and new, accurate product as described!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph powell

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble finding a good quality sneaker in a wide width at my local stores. Even the Under Armour Outlet Store hardly had any of the styles in the 4E width sizes. I ordered these through Amazon and received them in less than one week. They fit perfectly and are extremely comfortable. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Doug5336

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's Charged Assert 8 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: NEUTRAL: For runners who need a balance of flexibility & cushioning. Lightweight mesh upper with 3-color digital print delivers complete breathability. Durable leather overlays for stability & that locks in your midfoot. EVA sockliner provides soft, step-in comfort. Charged Cushioning midsole uses compression molded foam for even greater responsiveness & durability, providing optimal cushioning & energy return. Solid rubber outsole covers high impact zones for greater durability with less weight. Offset:. Weight: 9.9 oz.
feature_bullets: NEUTRAL: For runners who need a balance of flexibility & cushioning
Lightweight mesh upper with 3-color digital print delivers complete breathability
Material Composition: UPPER: 50% Leather, 46% Textile, 4% Synthetic~OUTSOLE: 75% R
Durable leather overlays for stability & that locks in your midfoot
EVA sockliner provides soft, step-in comfort
Charged Cushioning midsole uses compression molded foam for even greater responsiveness & durability, providing optimal cushioning & energy return
